derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: from French casaque 'long coat', from Italian casacca 'riding coat', probably from Turkic kazak 'vagabond'. Compare with Cossack

entry.tran: (某些教派神职人员所穿、通常为黑色的)长袍，法衣
entry.def: A cassock is a long piece of clothing, often black, that is worn by members of the clergy in some churches.

means.word_mean: 1. a black garment reaching down to the ankles; worn by priests or choristers
